pullRequest.title: Minor cleanups to encapsulate ES-specifics in storage module.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Motivation and Context


This PR is performing a couple of smaller cleanups to advance
encapsulating ES-specific details in the storage module. It does:

move the remaining usage of SortOrder to storage module
remove an unused method
move IndexHelper class to ES module

How Has This Been Tested?



Screenshots (if appropriate):
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

commit.message: Removing unused method, moving `IndexHelper` to ES module.
Moving remaining usage of `SortOrder` to storage module.

beforeCommit.message: Moving remaining usage of `SortOrder` to storage module.

afterCommit.message: Moving remaining usage of `SortOrder` to storage module.

nodes.bodyText: How about SortOrderMapper to make it sound less pompous? :)

commit.message: Renaming `SortOrderFactory` to `SortOrderMapper` (it is actually mapping, not creating).
